phrases.usage: Use this to describe the noise level and general atmosphere of your residential surroundings.
phrases.example: It's a quiet area because there is limited traffic, so it is perfect for studying at home.

phrases.usage: Use this to indicate the proximity of your home to essential services or landmarks.
phrases.example: It's close to the city library, so I can access academic resources without needing a car.

phrases.usage: Use this to introduce the primary advantage or most positive feature of your neighborhood.
phrases.example: The best thing is the efficient public transport because it allows me to commute quickly to work.

phrases.usage: Use this to professionally mention a specific disadvantage or negative aspect of where you live.
phrases.example: One downside is the lack of green spaces, so I have to travel further to visit a park.

phrases.usage: Use this to contrast your current neighborhood with another location to provide a better perspective.
phrases.example: Compared to the city center, it's significantly more affordable, so I can save more money each month.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe the convenience or accessibility of certain activities in your area.
phrases.example: You can easily access the main highway, so traveling to neighboring cities is very convenient.

phrases.usage: Use this to highlight the abundance of specific facilities or amenities in your vicinity.
phrases.example: There are plenty of local businesses nearby, so the neighborhood supports a vibrant local economy.

keyVocabulary.definition: A desirable or useful feature of a building or place.
Designed for people to live in rather than for commercial or industrial use.
To travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.
The basic physical and organizational structures needed for the operation of a society.
Nearness in space, time, or relationship.
